text.data-name: Heat oil in a sufuria,add in the onion and ginger. Let this cook over a medium flame until browned. Stir in the meat and replace lid over sufuria.Let the meat cook for about three minutes (the meat should be tender). If the meat has not softened allow it
text.tspan: Heat oil in a sufuria,add in the onion and ginger. Let this cook over a medium flame until browned.
Stir in the meat and replace lid over sufuria.Let the meat cook for about three minutes (the meat should be tender).
softened allow it to cook for a few more minutes.

text.data-name: Add pilau masala and salt while stirring continuously to ensure the spices are well-distributed. (You may also add a little water incase your meat is dry and sticking to the sufuria.) Add tomato paste and continue to stir. Add
text.tspan: Add pilau masala and salt while stirring continuously to ensure the spices are well-distributed.
water incase your meat is dry and sticking to the sufuria.)
Add tomato paste and continue to stir. Add

text.data-name: Reduce the heat and allow the rice to simmer while covered. After about 5 minutes of cooking, give the rice a stir using a fork and cover. Repeat the stirring one or two more times to ensure the rice is cooking evenly and does not stick to bottom of su
text.tspan: Reduce the heat and allow the rice to simmer while covered. After about 5 minutes of cooking, give the rice a stir
using a fork and cover. Repeat the stirring one or two more times to ensure the rice is cooking evenly and does not
The rice should cook until all excess water has evaporated.
Once ready, the dish may be accompanied with some kachumbari
